that's not all you said. You said borderless etc.. but anyhow, it being "stuck" to the desktop is an issue of the window manager. On KDE you can just alt+f3 on a window and set that from there

well that guide describes how to make it transparent and borderless
yeah the question is pinning it :D
which is handled by the window manager, as I said. Not running gnome so can't check for sure, but perhaps try clicking the icon on the very top-left of the window (normally  next to File, Edit etc)
